title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1273 - Fuel Handling
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1273 - Fuel Handling

State Regulations
§ 1273.1 - Fueling prohibited while engine running or being heated
§ 1273.2 - Aircraft and fuel dispensing apparatus to be grounded by wire
§ 1273.3 - Fueling to be conducted at least 50 feet from buildings
§ 1273.4 - Presence of at least two approved fire extinguishers required
§ 1273.5 - Operation of aircraft radio or electrical equipment prohibited
§ 1273.6 - Operation of airborne radar equipment restricted
§ 1273.7 - Presence of passengers, unauthorized persons and smoking prohibited during fuel handling
§ 1273.8 - Care required to prevent fuel overflow
§ 1273.9 - Starting of engines while fuel on ground prohibited
§ 1273.10 - Use of fuel and lubricant facilities restricted
§ 1273.11 - Transfer of bulk fuel within terminal boundaries prohibited
§ 1273.12 - Automotive and ramp equipment refueling restricted

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1273

Statutory authority: N.Y. Laws 1921, ch. 154, art. VI and
N.J. Laws 1921, ch. 151, consented to by Congress 42 U.S. Stat. 174 [1921]; N.Y. Laws 1922, ch. 43 and N.J. Laws 1922, ch. 9, consented to by Congress 42
U.S. Stat. 822 [1922]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
